concept.title: Configuring clients for SSL
concept.abstract: The Couchbase Server client libraries support client-side encryption using the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocol. To enable SSL on the client-side, you need to get an SSL certificate from Couchbase Server, as described in , and then follow the steps specific to the client you are using.

section.title: Configuring the Java client for SSL
section.p: To configure SSL for the Java client:

ol.li: Get the SSL certificate from Couchbase Server.

li.p: Store the certificate in your Java virtual machine (JVM) keystore.

section.title: Configuring the .NET client for SSL
section.p: To configure SSL for the .NET client:

ol.li: Get the SSL certificate from Couchbase Server.
Store the certificate in the Microsoft Windows Trusted Root Certification Authorities certificate store.

li.p: Enable SSL support on the client.

You can enable SSL at either the cluster level or on a per-Bucket basis. Setting SSL support at the cluster level means that all buckets within the cluster will use SSL. If you want to use SSL only on specific buckets, just configure your individual bucket to use SSL. Here's some examples:
